alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 08 at 5:08AM PST until November 09 at 7:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE APPLE/EL DORADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following area, San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall rates are expected to increase through the morning with rainfall rates of one-half to one inch per hour at times between 9 AM and 5 PM. Rainfall rates could briefly reach 1 to 1.5 inch per hour, mainly between 9 AM and 3 PM. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Apple/El Dorado burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following area, San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Apple/El Dorado burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Apple/El Dorado burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall rates are expected to increase through the morning with rainfall rates of one-half to one inch per hour at times between 10 AM and 6 PM. Rainfall rates could briefly reach 1 to 1.5 inch per hour. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
